instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2850 with one ram slot ram giving 3 bips error second slot is ok
threads.message:
Hi,
This one is not liquid damaged, fixed charging circuitry and it's back to life,
However, only one slot (bottom) is working.
If I insert a ram stick in the top slot, it will give 3 bips errors.
If I put no ram stick on both slots, I have the normal one bip missing ram.
Only If I use the bottom slot it works fine.
I will not bother too much and just max out the working slot,
But I wonder what rail can I check that is exclusive to the non working slot?
Thanks

threads.title: 820-2850 with one ram slot ram giving 3 bips error second slot is ok
threads.message: Start checking the solders near to to the corners.

threads.title: 820-2850 with one ram slot ram giving 3 bips error second slot is ok
threads.message: If it's not corner solder related it's likely a bad RAM slot and no repair for it. As 2informaticos said, verify solder points for top ram slot.

threads.title: 820-2850 with one ram slot ram giving 3 bips error second slot is ok
threads.message: Yeah solder on the corners look ok. No cracks

threads.title: 820-2850 with one ram slot ram giving 3 bips error second slot is ok
threads.message: 4GB stick in working slot and move on
